Suppose $X$ and $Y$ are jointly absolutely continuous random variables with joint density

$$
f_{XY}(x,\,y)=xe^{-x(y+1)},\quad x,\,y>0.
$$

a.  Find the marginal density of $X$.
a.  Find the marginal density of $Y$.
a.  Are $X$ and $Y$ independent?
a.  Find the conditional density of $X$ given $Y=y$.
a.  Find the conditional density of $Y$ given $X=x$.
